09:10 <vmassol> acotiuga: you need to share your filter for BFD  
09:10 <vmassol> otherwise it can't be accessed by others  
09:10 <acotiuga> checking now  
09:10 <vmassol> (good morning btw! :))  
09:10 <acotiuga>  good morning  
09:13 <acotiuga> Only users with the "Create Shared Filter" global permission can do this. To assign this permission, go to Administration, then Global Permissions, then add the permission.  
09:13 <acotiuga> hmm, I guess I'm not allowed ?  
09:14 <vmassol> checking  
09:15 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:16 <vmassol> should be ok now acotiuga  
09:16 <acotiuga> I can't edit the filter either. I can rename it, delete it, cope but not edit  
09:18 <acotiuga> This filter is visible to:      Everyone

21:08 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
21:25 <Daemoen> aft'noon folks :)  
21:26 <anticitizen> has joined #xwiki  
21:27 <anticitizen> Hello! Can anyone tell me what user attributes can be pulled from LDAP authentication?  
21:27 <Slashman> has quit  
21:27 <anticitizen> like setting permissions based on AD data?  
21:27 <woshilapin> has quit  
21:27 <anticitizen> or does it simply create a generic user account?  
21:31 <sorinello> has quit  
21:32 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki  
21:59 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
22:30 <mflorea> has quit  
22:38 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
22:38 <vmassol1> has quit  
23:04 <Daemoen> whats the easiest way of natively enabling markdown editing for xwiki ?  
23:18 <vmassol> hi Daemoen  
23:18 <Daemoen> hey vmassol :)  
23:19 <vmassol> by natively you mean enabling markdown by default for new pages?  
23:19 <Daemoen> yes  
23:19 <vmassol> see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Configuration#HConfiguringWikiSyntaxesanddefaultSyntax  
23:19 <Daemoen> markdown as an alternative to wiki syntax  
23:20 <Daemoen> and whats the current status of the rendering upgrade for MD1.1 support ?  
23:20 <vmassol> hmm I wasn't aware of MD 1.1  
23:20 <vmassol> do you have a link?  
23:20 <Daemoen> last update I see re above is from you on 11/27/2015  
23:20 <Daemoen> http://rendering.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Markdown11  
23:20 <vmassol> Right now our markdown/1.1 syntax is http://rendering.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Markdown11  
23:20 <vmassol> that's MD 1.0  
23:21 <vmassol> I mean it's MD  
23:21 <vmassol> I thgoght you were mentioning another version of Markdown :)  
23:21 <vmassol> so wdym by status?  
23:21 <vmassol> it's been there and working for some time now  
23:21 <Daemoen> is the syntax at 1.0 or 1.1? :)  
23:22 <Daemoen> the top says that it supports 1.0, but mentions 1.1 in the same paragraph, thats what im confused by  
23:22 <vmassol> the version corresponds to our support of MD  
23:22 <vmassol> AFAIK MD doesn't version its syntax  
23:22 <vmassol> so this is something internal to xwiki  
23:22 <Daemoen> right,  have you guys got to 1.1 of the syntax plugin so that macros can be included (i believe that thats the best way of clarifying)  
23:23 <vmassol> sure  
23:23 <Daemoen> or is it still at 1.0 of the syntax plugin  
23:23 <vmassol> everything on http://rendering.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Markdown11 works  
23:23 <Daemoen> ahh, cool :)  
23:24 <Daemoen> thats what i wasnt able to derive from that page, lol  
23:24 <vmassol> everything that's documented on xwiki.org works :) (barring bugs), except for design pages or draft pages  
23:24 <Daemoen> gotcha  
23:25 <vmassol> actually  
23:25 <vmassol> if you want to have a deeper status  
23:25 <vmassol> hmm no forget it, it doesn't work :)  
23:25 <Daemoen> im hoping to (next week) be able to start working on getting xwiki into sandstorm, so ill probably be pestering you a fair bit more regularly  
23:25 <vmassol> I wanted to point you to the tests reports for each syntax  
23:26 <vmassol> but the report is broken atm apparently, I'll need to fix it first ;)  
23:26 <vmassol> Daemoen: ah yes I'm eager to see that  
23:27 <Daemoen> i dont suppose xwiki does 'sponsored' featres/fixes =D  
23:27 <Daemoen> since there is one thing I would love to get working soon =D  
23:27 <vmassol> XWiki SAS does that  
23:28 <vmassol> you should check http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Support#HProfessionalSupport  
23:28 <vmassol> you should send a contact message to XWiki SAS (you can say you're coming on my recommendation ;))  
23:29 <vmassol> for ex using the contact form at http://www.xwiki.com/en/company/contact-us  
23:29 <Daemoen> hehe,  wonder how much they will charge me to make the boto bindings for python work as importable modules \*laughs\*  
23:30 <vmassol> hehe, no idea, would need to know more about it  
23:31 <vmassol> what I can tell you though is that XWiki SAS has the best xwiki experts, so they should be able to handle that as efficitently and as fast as it's possible  
23:31 <anticitizen> has quit  
23:31 <Daemoen> given that this is a \*personal\* thing, it will be coming out of my own pocket, lol  
23:31 <vmassol> hmm indeed could be costly for an individual  
23:32 <Daemoen> the irony is that it would benefit a \*ton\* of companies around the world,  being able to plugin boto and generate dynamic information from EC2 would be an insane feature to have =D  
23:32 <Daemoen> it's on my list of things to 'get to' in the near future =D  
23:34 <Daemoen> the fact that you guys already support external scripting platforms already puts you ahead of confluence by leaps and bounds (especially since they switched purely to the onCloud hosting :(),  their extendability has diminished drastically  
23:34 <vmassol> one thing you could do is send a mail to the xwiki list, describing it and see what people think about it, whether someone would be interested to help out, etc  
23:34 <Daemoen> \* nods \*  
23:37 <vmassol> ok bed time here, nn! have fun and don't hesitate to ping me for the sandstorm.io stuff  
23:37 <Daemoen> will do :)  
23:38 <Daemoen> later vmassol :)  
23:38 <vmassol> has quit
